DOCNAME: CASE OF ARAT AND OTHERSv. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial;Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property
JUDGES: András Sajó;Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Nona Tsotsoria;Vladimiro Zagrebelsky
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE respectively , and live in the town of LOC .
CARDINAL . The applicants were all employed as manual workers by ORG ( hereafter “ the ORG ” ) until their contracts of employment were terminated by ORG on DATE .

CARDINAL . On various dates in DATE the applicants brought proceedings before ORG of First Instance against ORG and claimed their unpaid salaries and other pecuniary rights to which they were entitled under the applicable legislation .
CARDINAL . The applicants ' claims were partly accepted by ORG in its decisions adopted on DATE and DATE .
CARDINAL . DATE the applicants initiated enforcement proceedings against ORG and sought to obtain the sums awarded to them by ORG together with statutory interest .
CARDINAL . The sums claimed by the applicants were as follows :

CARDINAL . In the course of the enforcement proceedings , the applicants unsuccessfully attempted to recover their monies from ORG bank accounts at the ORG owned ORG . The bank refused to make the payments on the ground that the monies deposited there by ORG had been allocated to a special fund earmarked for public services . Following this , ORG transferred all their monetary assets to the special fund to circumvent ORG decisions .
CARDINAL . At the time of the adoption of the present judgment the applicants ' attempts at recovering their monies were still continuing .
CARDINAL . For a summary of the relevant domestic law and practice , see GPE and Others v. GPE , nos . CARDINAL , QUANTITY and CARDINAL , § § CARDINAL , DATE .
